title: ICE: `Unexpected type Alias(...) for 'Field' projection `, edition 2021

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code `src/test/ui/type-alias-impl-trait/issue-96572-unconstrained.rs` ```Rust #![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)] // check-pass fn main() {} fn upvar() { #[derive(Copy, Clone)] struct Foo((u32, u32)); type T = impl Copy; let foo: T = Foo((1u32, 2u32)); let x = move || { let Foo((a, b)) = foo; }; } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0-nightly (74699b82c 2022-12-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: 74699b82cac980b9fb423a4ec2f131209b6a7630 commit-date: 2022-12-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output `rustc issue-96572-unconstrained.rs --edition=2021` ``` ```
Backtrace
